para: Domain objects are part of the post-solution analysis framework, in which useful data is extracted from the &mesh;. The Domain is the subset of the &mesh; to which the sampling is applied. When the domain is set to ElementGroup, the sampling points are distributed inside the specified &mesh; &elems;.
ElementGroup domains support sampling methods in the point and element categories.

The elements parameter specifies which elements to sample. It should either be the name of an element group, or the special placeholder object, selected, indicating that the currently selected elements should be used.

note.para: When sampling an ElementGroup on a grid, the grid is fit into the ElementGroup's bounding box, that is, the smallest rectangle that contains all of the elements. This means that it's possible that some of the grid points might not lie inside of an element in the group.
